newsitem.title: POLAND: Daiwa sees BPH net up to PLN in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Daiwa sees BPH net up to PLN in 1997.

text.p: Daiwa Europe Limited expects Polish Bank Przemyslowo-Handlowy SA (BPH) net profit to rise to 304.9 million zlotys in 1997, up from last year's 266.3 million, Daiwa said in a report dated April 3.
Daiwa said in its Central European and CIS Research BPH's price earnings ratio was likely to fall to 5.9 in 1997 from last year's 6.8.
Daiwa said BPH was one of the most profitable Polish banks, largely due to a well diversified loan portfolio with a growing proportion of higher margin personal loans. @

It also said the bank's strengths were its possible further acquisitions, entering a strategic alliance with a foreign partner and joining a bank-insurance group to bid for a majority stake in Polish Powszechny Bank Kredytowy SA.
